source_caption_data.pre_caption: A wide shot frames a kayaker from a third-person perspective, positioned in the center foreground. The camera is mounted behind the subject, looking over their shoulders and the bow of their pink kayak, which occupies the bottom center of the frame. The kayaker paddles forward through whitewater, flanked by the tree-lined, rocky walls of a gorge in the middle ground on the left and right. As the kayaker goes over a waterfall, their position in the frame remains centered, but they move rapidly downward. The camera, locked in position behind them, tilts down, following the descent and shifting the view from a forward perspective to one looking directly down into the churning water at the base of the falls. The gorge walls appear to rise up on either side as the kayaker drops deeper into the canyon.
